text: Andrzej Franciszek Dziuba (born October 10, 1950) is a Polish Roman Catholic bishop. From 2004 to 2024 he was the bishop of Łowicz. == Early life and education == Andrzej Dziuba was born in Pleszew, Poland. He was ordained as a priest on May 14, 1978, by Cardinal Stefan Wyszyński. He later earned degrees in theology and canon law. == Ecclesiastical career == On March 27, 2004, Pope John Paul II appointed him as the Bishop of Łowicz. He was consecrated on May 22, 2004, by Cardinal Józef Glemp. == Scandals and Controversies == In 2020, complaints were filed to the Vatican accusing Dziuba of hiding cases of sexual abuse by some priests in his diocese. Archbishop Grzegorz Ryś led the investigation and sent the documents to the Vatican. In 2022, the Polish State Commission on Pedophilia reported Dziuba to the prosecutor for failing to inform law enforcement about sexual abuse by a chaplain in 2016. Following a canonical investigation, Pope Francis accepted Dziuba's resignation as Bishop of Łowicz on March 9, 2024. == References == == Other websites == * Official website of the Diocese of Łowicz Category:1950 births Category:Living people Category:Polish Roman Catholic bishops Category:Catholic Church sexual abuse scandals
